Comsoc.title: StuFac presents: Putting with the Profs
Comsoc.description:
StuFac's inaugural "Putting with the Profs" is this Tuesday, November 15 at 6:30PM!

Come out and enjoy a round of mini-putt with your professors. Professors attending include K. Rogers, D. McConomy, C. Miners, T. Wang, G. Boland and M. LaBarge. The fee is only $10 and includes transportation to and from Putt N’ Blast plus mini-golfing!

Sign-up in the atrium from Wednesday, November 9 to Tuesday, November 15 (Excluding Friday). Space is limited; don’t miss out!

Comsoc.description:

We are confident that the executive committee will bring QACE 2012 to new heights!

-QACE 2012 Co-Chairs

Chelsea Stanimir & Andy Lightstone

Comsoc.title: REMINDER: I.C.B.C. Volunteer Application are due FRIDAY!
Comsoc.description:
REMINDER: I.C.B.C. 2011 Volunteer Applications due this Friday at 11:59pm!

Don’t miss out on the opportunity to be a volunteer at Canada’s oldest and most prestigious case competition!  Apply to volunteer at the Inter-Collegiate Business Competition, held January 5-7 2011.  

The applicaiton process is so easy! 

Send an email to kgosnell@icbconline.ca with the following template completed:

Name:

Year:

Queen’s Email Address:

Will you be eligible to be a driver? (age 21+, holding G2 or G license or equivalent license accepted by Ontario government as of January 5th 2011)

  • Please include a list of the volunteer positions, ranked in order of preference
  • Attach a one-page resume to your email  

    • Emails are due Friday, November 11th by 11:59pm.

    Secondly, sign up for an interview slot on MyComSoc – interviews will be held on November 15th and 17th.  This should be done by November 11th at the latest.

    Finally, take an 8.5” x 11” piece of blank white paper and do something creative with it, in some way relating to I.C.B.C. (love of I.C.B.C., why you should be an I.C.B.C. volunteer).  Have some fun, do something unique that shows your commitment to I.C.B.C. and put some effort in.  Bring this to your interview.

    Volunteers must be able to return to Kingston for a pre-event meeting at 2:30 pm on Thursday, January 5th

     If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to email Katie Gosnell at kgosnell@icbconline.ca

     

    We look forward to receiving your applications!

    Volunteer position descriptions are attached.

Comsoc.title: CCC - Hockey Night in Commerce
Comsoc.description:
This Saturday the final round of the Hockey Night in Commerce tournament will be played. The tournament is played by teams representing each of the four years of the commerce program. It is organized by the Cure Cancer Classic committee (CCC) with the goal of fundraising for the Canadian Cancer Society through hockey related events.

The consolation final will be played at 5:30pm between the 1st and 3rd year teams, and the finals will follow at 6:30pm between the 2nd and 4th year teams.

We are organizing a school bus to pick fans up at Goodes Hall at 5:10 pm to go watch the two games. The bus will return back to Goodes after the second game. Tickets are $5 and all proceeds go towards our donation to the Canadian Cancer Society. The tournament is a great way to watch some hockey and see some of your commerce friends play.

The facebook event is in the link below, and if you would like a ticket please message myself (8twm@queensu.ca) or anyone else on the CCC executive.

Thanks,
Taylor McManus - CCC Co-Chair

 

http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=236136859778769

Comsoc.title: QNP Presents: Make The Leap Speakers on November 15th at 5:30 p.m.
Comsoc.description:
Ever wonder about how your commerce degree applies to the exciting and dynamic world of non Profits. Want to know how your skills can help you Make the Leap? 

QNP is proud to host Darren Dougall, Executive Director of Youth Diversion as our first speaker on:

 Tuesday, November 15th at 5:30 in Goodes 400.

Mr. Dougall has had an extensive career in education and academia before making the leap into non-profits full time. He has been featured numerous times in the Globle and Mail, and is excited to share his transition and experiences in the non-profit industry with you.

Free snacks & refreshments will be served.

We hope to see you all there! Check out our Facebook page here

Comsoc.title: Q3C Co-Chair Hiring!!
Comsoc.description:
After an amazing competition this past weekend, the Queen's Commerce Coporate Challenge (Q3C) is hiring new co-chairs!

For all interested please submit the application below to Jemima Fogarty (8jkf@queensu.ca) and Alanna Fonseca (8af38@queensu.ca) by Friday, November 18th at 11:59pm!!


Q3Cheers,

Jemima and Alanna

Comsoc.title: COMM'12: Karaoke Social!
Comsoc.description:
Long awaited & highly anticipated!

We're almost done our last Fall semester of our undergraduate degrees... Ridiculous! Let's get together to celebrate, maybe sing All the Small Things?

Be at Tir Nan Og on Thursday, November 17th by 10PM.

And of course, feel free to invite anyone I've missed & your non-COMM'12 friends.

RSVP on the Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/#!/event.php?eid=225376707527890

Comsoc.title: “DECA has H’art”
Comsoc.description: “DECA has H’art” – The DECA Queen’s Executive will be donating their time to H’art School of Smiles this weekend. H’art has been selected as the organization featured in the annual Charity Case Challenge, which runs during the DECA Queen's Invitational. H’art is a non-profit organization committed to helping adults with intellectual disabilities reach their highest potential through arts and education. DECA will be lending them a helping hand this weekend as they repaint their studio and build tables in an effort to rejuvenate the school.

Comsoc.title: Q'CIA Travel Team Announced
Comsoc.description:
Q'CIA is proud to announce that our team is complete after hiring our travel team! 12 lucky individuals came out on top from a pool of over 40 applicants, and we're excited to welcome them to the Q'CIA family. The Q'CIA 2012 Travel Team is - Anders Wan, Andrew Dawson, Christie Baugh, Chris Ho, Crystal Yang, Danielle Amirault, Danielle Milano, Ellen Hyslop, Emma Squires, Katie Taft, Ronald Lei and Tyler Hennick. Congratulations! We couldn't be more excited to add these people to our team and spend 10 days with them in Nicaragua.

Q'CIA love - your cochairs, Sarah and Rachel

Comsoc.title: Q'BFFI Co Chair Hiring!
Comsoc.description:
Q'BFFI is NOW hiring the 2012 Co-Chairs! 

With an amazing conference that took place two weekends ago, we are more than excited to round up the next CoChairs to begin planning another epic weekend! Applications are due November 15th at 11:59pm. Please don't forget to sign up for an interview. Interviews will begin on Wednesday. Email your applications to 8vn@queensu.ca and 8lr18@queensu.ca and if you have any questions at all, feel free to contact us! :)

 

Q*BFFI LOVE,

Laura and Vi
